headline: Food inflation: How tariffs could impact your grocery bill
summary: Food inflation has begun to slow after the US Bureau of Labor Statistics (BLS) reported prices to have rose 0.2% in February month-over-month. Former United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) economist Richard Volpe sits down with Brad Smith to talk about how tariffs are playing into food and beverage prices, dependent on which countries are being targeted by the Trump administration's trade policies. Volpe is currently a professor of agribusiness at California Polytechnic State University (Cal Poly). Also catch Richard Volpe weigh in on the price pressures multinational agriculture provider Dole plc (DOLE) is facing on pineapples and citrus fruits. headline: Why PepsiCo Stock Withered on Wednesday
summary: Unfortunately for PepsiCo (NASDAQ: PEP), it is in the former category.  Reuters reported that a group of top American food and drink makers formally requested that President Donald Trump exempt a range of comestible inputs from the current round of tariffs.  In a letter to the President, PepsiCo and peers such as J.M. Smucker and Conagra Brands asked that "Trump exempt ingredients not available from U.S. sources to protect manufacturers who otherwise buy from domestic farmers and suppliers," the news agency wrote.
